page.title: 06SCHOOLS
page.content: Our area is well served with 6 primary schools.Five are of post war modern design and only St Mary's, Duntocher is of the older traditional style.The four protestant schools Faifley, Edinbarnet,Goldenhill and Carleith altogether educate 1066 pupils while the two R.C schools St Mary's and St. Joseph's have 656 pupils. 240 Pre-school children attend Faifley and Edinbarnet nurseries.There is also an after school centre in Faifley for children of working mothers attended by 240 primary aged children. Auchentoshan school for the mentally handicapped has 106 pupils, not only from Clydebank but also from the surrounding area.There is also an adult training centre for the mentally handicapped with 120 students.
